Bloomberg has a big story out today about a tiny microchip not much bigger than a grain of rice.
The chip has been found in the type of computer servers used by at least 30 major American companies including Apple and major banks, also servers used by the Pentagon and the CIA.
Bloomberg describes this chip as, quote, ""a stealth doorway into any network that included the altered machines."" And this doorway, Bloomberg reports, was built in China.
Michael Riley is one of the reporters who broke this story today.
